lines.value: 'They met me in the day of success: and I have

lines.speaker: LADY MACBETH

lines.speaker: LADY MACBETH

lines.speaker: LADY MACBETH

lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Henceforth be earls, the first that ever Scotland
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: In such an honour named. What's more to do,
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Which would be planted newly with the time,
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: As calling home our exiled friends abroad
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: That fled the snares of watchful tyranny;
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Producing forth the cruel ministers
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Of this dead butcher and his fiend-like queen,
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Who, as 'tis thought, by self and violent hands
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Took off her life; this, and what needful else
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: That calls upon us, by the grace of Grace,
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: We will perform in measure, time and place:
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: So, thanks to all at once and to each one,
lines.speaker: MALCOLM

lines.value: Whom we invite to see us crown'd at Scone.
lines.speaker: MALCOLM
